column1: - Burning and painful eyes - Burning in mouth and throat - Diarrhea - Irritated skin - Nausea - Slurred speech - Swelling of mouth - Swelling of tongue - Vomiting Blistering and swelling in the mouth may be severe enough to prevent normal speaking and swallowing.
Do NOT give water or milk if the patient is having symptoms (such as vomiting, convulsions, or a decreased level of alertness) that make it hard to swallow.
